6/ and yet, as programmable money, bitcoin keeps evolving, evolving, evolving. Making static statements about its success or failure will always appear foolish 5 yrs down the line.

5/ As a long term SoV, bitcoin is superior to fiat. As a MoE, there are cases when bitcoin is better, but often fiat is more convenient. As a UoA, bitcoin has this nailed in cryptoland, but not much anywhere else.

4/ My own theses for bitcoin have evolved over the years & I agree it’s not fulfilling all three functions of how a currency is traditionally defined on par with well established currencies, but that doesn’t = failure.
2/ Once unleashed, cryptoassets tend to take on a life of their own, as they’re guided by a community of constantly changing individuals.
1/ Claiming that Bitcoin has failed, fails to recognize these are open source software networks that morph and evolve over time.
